testcase: Missing APIs in default tag error for typespec conversion PR
query:
title: Missing APIs in default tag error for typespec conversion PR

question: PR: https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/35346
Avocado check: https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/35346/checks?check_run_id=44368323389
Is there a way to suppress the missing APIs check only for this PR since it only has typspec conversion but no update to the open API spec?
The check is trying to compare the APIs with previous stable release with currently published stable release.
ground_truth: Part of the typespec conversion is replacing the existing swagger with a generated swagger.  The generated swagger is still used for some purposes, and Avocado protects the ability to process it. The generated swagger needs to be equivalent, but not necessarily identical.  Generally these issues reflected in the swagger will also show up in breaking change checks, which will have to be resolved (or suppressed if they are false positives)

expected_knowledges.title: Missing APIs in default tag error for typespec conversion PR

query:
title: ArmResourcePatchAsync & discriminator

question: I was trying to figure out the best way to allow an update for a Host resource. I tried ArmResourcePatchAsync, but the resource has a discriminator. oav fails with OBJECT_MISSING_REQUIRED_PROPERTY_DEFINITION .  [Windows Server AHB for VMware via PATCH by cataggar · Pull Request #25538 · Azure/azure-rest-api-sp…](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/pull/25538)
ground_truth: we generally suggest that PATCH requests over discriminated types should require the discriminator property.  This may result in some lintdiff violations, but that is expected, and those cna be suppressed.  This is especially true if, as most services, your PATCH operation would need the discriminator value on the wire to determine how to apply the PATCH request to the existing reosurce.

query:
title: CI Failure – Swagger LintDiff

question: Hi team,
We have a TypeSpec PR that fixes the README format, but the CI check Swagger LintDiff failed with the following error:
`[Exception] No input files provided.`
I’ve verified that all `input-file` paths exist in this PR. Could this be a bug, or did I miss something in the configuration?
PR link: [updated readme by amber-Chen-86 · Pull Request #38209 · Azure/azure-rest-api-specs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/38209)
Thank you!
ground_truth: if you are fixing bugs already in main, this is expected.  lintdiff needs to run on your spec both before and after your PR, and if before is crashing, the PR to fix it will still crash.

expected_knowledges.title: `ProvisioningStateMustBeReadOnly` lintdiff violation in TypeSpec for ARM Service

testcase: PR gateway pipelines not starting/waiting for long time
query:
title: PR gateway pipelines not starting/waiting for long time

question: Hi team,
we are adding new api version to our current swagger and in that 2 pipeline checks are queued/waiting from long time and not getting the status reported due to which we cant merge the swagger as these are required ones.
```
2 pending checks
SDK Validation Status  Expected — Waiting for status to be reported  Required
Swagger PrettierCheck  Expected — Waiting for status to be reported  Required
```
PR - [Swagger Changes for Solution Metadata RT by AbhishekSinha-AEP · Pull Request #24090 · Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/pull/24090)
We also tried to create same new PR in thought that old PR may have some transient issue but in newly create same PR we are facing same issue
New PR: [Swagger Changes for Solution Metadata RT by AbhishekSinha-AEP · Pull Request #24204 · Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr](https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/pull/24204)
In both PRs. same facing same issue and cannot head towards merge.
Can some one help here.
Thanks
ground_truth:
Looks like a permissions issue.  The PR author needs to make their membership in Azure public, not private.  And also join the Azure SDK Partners group.
https://aka.ms/azsdk/access
https://github.com/orgs/Azure/people?query=AbhishekSinha-AEP

expected_knowledges.title: PR gateway pipelines not starting/waiting for long time

testcase: RPaaSMaster branch requirement for Ring 0 services
query:
title: RPaaSMaster branch requirement for Ring 0 services

question: For merging the API spec to main branch in public repo, there seems to be a pre-req on merging the spec in RPaaSMaster branch.
We are a ring 0 service and have gotten exception from onboarding to RPaaS. Do we still need to merge into RPaaSMaster branch? I see that Microsoft.Compute, which is also a ring 0 RP, is not present in the RPaaSMaster branch either.
ground_truth: Based on the available knowledge context, syncing API specs between the public 'main' branch and the private 'RPaaSMaster' branch is the responsibility of the spec owner. There is no strict requirement in the referenced documentation that all resource providers (including ring 0 services like Microsoft.Compute) must have their specs present in RPaaSMaster if they have received an explicit exemption from RPaaS onboarding. The documentation and FAQ state that if your service is not onboarded to RPaaS (and has an exception), you do not need to merge your specs into RPaaSMaster. The presence or absence of Microsoft.Compute in RPaaSMaster does not dictate requirements for other RPs; each spec owner is responsible for their own onboarding and branch sync according to their onboarding status and exemptions. If your ring 0 service has an approved exception, you can continue to manage your specs in 'main' and do not need to merge into RPaaSMaster unless instructed otherwise by the ARM or EngSys team.

expected_knowledges.title: Deep-dive into breaking changes on spec PRs

testcase: Looking for someone to suppress CI failures https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/36221
query:
title: Looking for someone to suppress CI failures https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/36221

question: Hi I'm looking for someone to help suppress CI Failure on this PR new addProxyAgentExtension property for proxyagentsettings by huiminyan2017 · Pull Request #36221 · Azure/azure-rest-api-specs
Compute has multiple API versions so the Avacado check failure is expected.
ground_truth:
Based on the information provided and the knowledge context, the Avocado CI failure in your PR (https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs/pull/36221) is expected because the Compute service currently has multiple API versions in its default tag, which violates the Uniform Versioning Principle. The Avocado check (MULTIPLE_API_VERSION) was recently made a blocking error to enforce this policy.
To temporarily suppress this failure and unblock your PR, you can add the Approved-Avocado label to your PR. However, this is only a one-time suppression and should be done if:
There is an ongoing discussion and plan to resolve the uniform versioning issue for Compute.
You or your team are aware that this is a temporary measure and are working towards compliance.
Important: Regular use of this suppression is discouraged. The long-term solution is to restructure your API versions so all components under Compute adopt a uniform versioning scheme, or split into independent services as outlined in the Uniform Versioning Violation Guide.
If you are not aware of any ongoing discussion or plan for resolution, you should reach out to azversioning@service.microsoft.com for guidance.
